message_1: In how many ways can 4 people be selected from a group of 10 people to form a committee?
message_2:
To find the number of ways to select 4 people from a group of 10, we use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of people (10 in this case) and k is the number of people to be selected (4 in this case).

C(10, 4) = 10! / (4!(10-4)!)

C(10, 4) = 10! / (4!6!)

C(10, 4) = (10 × 9 × 8 × 7) / (4 × 3 × 2 × 1)

C(10, 4) = 5040 / 24

C(10, 4) = 210

So, there are 210 ways to select 4 people from a group of 10 to form a committee.
